title.narrative: Disaster Resilience in the Compact Nations (RESILIENCE)

description.narrative: This project aims at supporting to national and state task forces on developing and implementing risk communication and community engagement plans related to the COVID-19 response in the Federated States of Micronesia and Republic of the Marshall Islands. In the Federal States of Micronesia, this includes the provision of technical guidance, production and distribution of national outreach campaigns, and facilitating online trainings for health workers using WHO standards; support to points of entry (POE) activities, including the improvement of infrastructure, procurement of safety and communication equipment to improve surveillance, and facilitating online trainings on screening and managing travelers for border and immigration officers. In the Republic of the Marshall Islands, this project responds to the overall planning and coordination activities of government counterparts, including by providing technical and resource support to emergency operations centers and national response planning efforts; improving communication pathways through communication equipment, trainings, and expanded risk communication and community engagement; and supporting POE measures through the development of standard operating procedures, quality assurance and quality control mechanisms, monitoring and evaluation and reporting mechanisms, as well as hygiene and infrastructure improvements.
